properties.name: Beijing Museum of Tap Water
properties.description: Posted by Platialchina beijingAddress: No.6 Courtyard (Qingshuiyuan Neighborhood), north street outside Dongzhimen, Beijing Tel: 8610-64650787 The museum is built on the original place of the first water plant in Beijing- Zhongzhimen Water Plant. Inside the museum, 130 real objects, 110 pictures, 40 models and sand tables on display reflect the 90-year-old history of Beijing tap water.

properties.name: Fayuan Buddhist Temple
properties.description: Posted by PlatialchinabeijingFayuan Temple is situated in Fayuansiqian Street, Xuanwu District of Beijing. It is the oldest extant temple in Beijing. The Relic Hall of Chinese Buddhism Books, located inside Fayuan Buddhist Temple with a long-standing history of 1,300 years in Beijing, is a museum of religious relics founded in 1980.

properties.name: Jianguomen Bridge - Ancient Observatory
properties.description: Posted by PlatialchinaBeijingThe Ancient Observatory, situated at the southeast corner of Beijing\'s Jianguomen Bridge, was initially built circa 1442, during the Ming Dynasty (1368-1644).

properties.name: Lush
properties.description: Posted by Platialchinatel: (010) 8286 3566 (info) underground rail: Wudaokou Student night club. Movies on Monday and live bands on Friday. Open-mike night on Sunday is standing room only.

properties.name: Maggie
properties.description: Posted by PlatialchinaAddress South Chaoyang Phone tel: (010) 8562 8142 tel: (010) 8562 8143 Transport underground rail: Jianguomen Maggies is one of the oldest and busiest bars in Beijing. Established in 1993 opposite the Kunlun Hotel it moved in 1997 next to the Hilton Hotel before moving to its current location in 1999 next to the East Gate of the Worker\'S Stadium. It got bigger and better each time. It has always enjoyed the reputation of having the best music in town and now has the space to generate a lively party atmosphere every night of the week.

properties.name: Panjiayuan Market
properties.description: Posted by PlatialchinabeijingLocation: off Dongsanhuan Nanlu (Third Ring Rd), South Chaoyang The Panjiayuan Market in Beijing is commonly called the Weekend Market or the Dirt Market. Panjiayuan Market is at its best on weekends. The Antique Zone is open every day and the Arts and Crafts Warehouse Zone is open on Saturday and Sunday only.
